page.title: 03Buildings_Chapelthorpe
page.content: The main part of the old Vicarage on Church Lane,Chaplethorpe was built in 1780. In 1820 the staircase was moved and corridors were put in. In 1903 there were some more alterations made to the house adding a study and recreation room. Some of the windows are old Victorian styles. In the large garden there is a small pillar which is chipped on the top and there is a legend that underneath there is a box with historical things in it. It only became a vicarage in 1903 before that it belonged to the Charlesworth family who once owned Chaplethorpe Hall. The building materials used on the old Vicarage are mainly old Yorkshire stone. Where the foundations of the Study are you can see modern house bricks. The main part of the house's exterior has a kind of rough rendered texture.
